items.summary: Configure GitHub Pages deployment settings to serve the built frontend application from the correct directory instead of displaying README file names when the deployment URL is accessed
Add a .nojekyll file to the deployment output to prevent GitHub Pages from treating the site as a Jekyll site and potentially ignoring critical frontend files
Ensure the build output directory structure is compatible with GitHub Pages by placing index.html and all compiled assets at the root level of the deployment branch
Configure base URL in the frontend build configuration to match the GitHub Pages deployment path if the site is deployed to a project subdirectory rather than a custom domain
